text: Advances in biochemistry and microscopy revealed the fundamental structure and function of cell membranes and proteins.
The fi rst key discoveries of gene expression were made in bacteria and bacteriophages.
Gene regulation discovered in bacteria provided models for animals and plants.
While the idea of cloning a dinosaur remains science fiction, the tools of microbial genetics of long-dead organisms preserved in museums.
On the positive side, the emerging world of molecular biology excited the imagination of young scientists Francisco.
The mechanisms of bacterial recombination us to transfer genes between the genomes of virtually all types of organisms.
During the twentieth century, amid world wars and societal transformations, the field of microbiology exploded with new knowledge (see Table 1.2).
More than 99% of what we know about microbes today was discovered after 1900 by scientists too numerous to cite in this book.
Growing numbers of students entered the field of molecular biology, seeking to invent medical cures—or even to clone dinosaurs, as in Michael Crichton’s novel and film Jurassic Park (1993).
Regulatory DNA-binding proteins were discovered in bacteria and then subsequently found in all classes of living organisms.
